poem:
### The Nothing Headphone

Gloss and glare, a Walkman's   
echo, whispers of Cybermen —  
these arcs of sound,  
contrived rebellions  

grasp the quiet with dot-matrix care.  
Transparent whispers hug the night,  
a statement wrapped 'round the routine.  

Yet beneath their clamor,  
silence still speaks,  
lost between design and dream.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Nothing Headphone 1 review: attention-seeking design for your head London-based Nothing’s latest gadget is a set of over-ear headphones that throws out the dull design norms of noise-cancelling cans for an attention-attracting look that is a cross between a 1980s Walkman and Doctor Who’s Cybermen. The large, semi-transparent cans are certainly a statement piece on your head, with an outer design covered in details, dot-matrix print and physical buttons, but sadly stopping short of the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
